column4: how to I fix a "X server failed to load" I'm not sure as to what I need to configure in xorg.conf to fix this
can anyone help with booting into ubuntu, everytime I try it says x server failed to load, how can I fix this?
?? with the live CD
aaah sound like something broke
FF didn't actually crash, I forced a quit on it and tried to restart the system
type  after the login  dkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
actually  sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
okay, I'll need to switch to that pc, what should I do after that
sorry did a typo
it will try and reconfigure the X server for you, you just answer the questions
ok, I'll give it a shot....Thank you
it did not work. The last option was color depth, I chose 24 and it put me back at the prompt, do I just restart or do I need to overwrite the existing xorg.conf somehow
choose something lower you can change it later
ok, what about after I choose the color depth, do I restart gdm or just restart the system
just run startx
could you take a look please http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/14570/
edit the /etc/X11/xorg.conf  file change Driver nvidia   line to Driver  nv
when I reconfigured I selected nv, is this different
nv is the built in nvidia driver
i looked in the xorg.conf, nv is already there for Driver
I'm new to linix, what would cause me to loose this window environment,  I haven't made any changes. I just restarted my system and it was gone
I might have the terminology wrong, I thought the x server was what window environments ran under
